data.text: @Skull_Bloke @alitwonk @Soapy_Wit_Tank @HiddenHereford1 Actually now I'm thinking about it, I'm wondering where Priory Junior School got 30 owl pellets from. And we all had to write a poem about it afterwards! That's Tynemouth for you.
@LZellas @alitwonk @Soapy_Wit_Tank @HiddenHereford1 Ohhh fantastic - is it time to do it again?
@alitwonk @Soapy_Wit_Tank @Skull_Bloke @HiddenHereford1 We did owl pellets in junior school, I loved it.
@alitwonk @Skull_Bloke Always a pleasure it was great fun and my 9 year old enjoyed both sessions!
@Skull_Bloke @HiddenHereford1 Lovely to meet you in person at last😊

@NTGates @alitwonk @HiddenHereford1 @RobertEFuller No doubt it happens occasionally, but only a tiny proportion of all the pellets the UK's owls produce in a year will ever get dissected & analysed by us bone geeks.  One of us is bound to get lucky eventually; the rest are doomed to a lifetime of weasel/pellet disappointment.

@Skull_Bloke @alitwonk @HiddenHereford1 Oh that's great Ric, cheers 👍. I believe @RobertEFuller has had tawny owls take weasels and possibly young stoats...not sure if he ever found the remains in pellets or elsewhere?

@NTGates @alitwonk @HiddenHereford1 Aww yes... in theory weasels can be found in pellets but in my experience they're almost unbelievably rare.  I've only ever found one owl-predated weasel fragment and that wasn't even in a pellet, just among some owl box sweepings. Story below... 😎 https://t.co/ftm9SBdmQX

@Skull_Bloke @alitwonk @HiddenHereford1 Ohhhh haha, I thought they looked chunky for weasel but owl pellet chatter threw me, that'd be some brave/mad owl!! I've even got polecat and mink skulls from road kill 🤦‍♂️ great and informative collection 👏👍
